channel.title: Whonix update removed application launcher? Why do this?
channel.description: The icon in the upper left corner that drops down to show applications is now gone with most recent whonix update. I have seen this on two different workstation vm's so it is not a error with an update. The only way i can even go to applications now is right click desktop and carefully open the submenus. If it werent for that feature i would be locked out of every program. Is there any way to get this back?

item.title: Whonix update removed application launcher? Why do this?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
fuckitalllls:

Why are you surprised at this?

Because it wasn’t be who made a related change.

Background:

Kicksecure – 9 Aug 22

Linux User Experience versus Commercial Operating Systems

Why Linux Distributions have bad Usability

(Whonix is based on Kicksecure.)

fuckitalllls:

I have the same whonix as everyone else, you should see this missing too.

Nobody else was reporting something similar. So I doubt Whonix is the cause or wouldn’t know how that’s possible. Not all mysteries can be investigated, resolved.

What other potential causes could there be?

  • User mistake.
  • User custom installed software introducing such a bug.
  • hardware issues → Troubleshooting - Whonix chapter Hardware Issues in Whonix wiki
  • More things I don’t know.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix update removed application launcher? Why do this?

item.title: Whonix update removed application launcher? Why do this?
item.dc:creator: fuckitalllls
item.description:
This advice caused my screen to turn black forcing me to reboot to see it again. Why are you surprised at this? I have the same whonix as everyone else, you should see this missing too.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix update removed application launcher? Why do this?

item.title: Whonix update removed application launcher? Why do this?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
It’s not a feature. Whonix source code changes do not include changes which could effect such a change. Could be a bug in a package from Debian.

fuckitalllls:

Is there any way to get this back?

Maybe.

Platform-specific Desktop Tips chapter Default Home Folder Configuration Files Reset in Whonix wiki

Whonix – 25 Jul 22

Information Booster might be Available!

Utilizing other resources to help solve questions/issues unspecific to Whonix ™.

Read full topic
